text: Ceiling type, grid profile, and acoustic tile model match approved submittals
Tile NRC (Noise Reduction Coefficient), CAC (Ceiling Attenuation Class) ratings match spec
Suspension wires, main tees, cross tees, trims, and hold-down clips reviewed and received
Mechanical, electrical, and sprinkler rough-ins completed and coordinated with ceiling layout
Perimeter wall angles installed level, continuous, and at correct height
Existing ceiling and services removed (if applicable); substrate conditions verified
Suspension wires installed to structure and spaced per code (typically 4’ o.c.)
Grid levelled and aligned with laser or string line
Main tees and cross tees clipped securely, square, and tight
Tiles cut cleanly, seated flat in grid, and corners square
Tiles installed tight to grid with no sagging or gaps
Tiles around lights, grilles, sprinklers cut and trimmed neatly
Access panels, light fixtures, and HVAC diffusers properly supported
Final height and alignment confirmed with reflected ceiling plan (RCP)
Punch list reviewed and deficiencies corrected
Closeout documents submitted including warranties and acoustical performance data

id: • NBC, ASTM C635 / C636 – Grid and Suspension Systems
• ASTM E1264 / E84 – Acoustic Tile Performance
• Manufacturer Specs: Armstrong, CertainTeed, CGC, Rockfon, USG
